item.name: 1960: The Making of the President
item.comment: Enjoyed it, need to play this some more before some real opinions surface...

item.name: 20th Century
item.comment: Cool auction game. I like the waste management. Reminded me of a lighter Antiquity in that respect.

item.name: 7 Wonders
item.comment: I like the drafting mechanic. I play mostly with 3 players, which feels very different (more cutthroat) than with more players. I played 2 players once and that was even more cutthroat.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Cities
item.comment: solid addition. adds a bit of randomness but gives some powerful cards and a new reason to have lots of coins.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders
item.comment: I like the added variety that comes with the leaders. Looking for powers combinations is interesting.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Leaders – Stevie
item.comment: Haven't used it yet, but it is in the deck of cards each game.

item.name: 7 Wonders: Manneken Pis
item.comment: I personally haven't got a chance to use it, but beer is a good consolation prize.

item.name: A la carte
item.comment: Interesting and fun. On the lighter side. Love making Crepes.

item.name: Ad Astra
item.comment: I was pleasantly surprised by this one. I like simultaneous action selection and this one put a different spin on it. I definitely prefer this to Starfarers of Catan

item.name: After the Flood
item.comment: Very interesting with tons of hard choices and chances for AP. Definitely looking forward to trying out other strategies. Has a good mix of long term and short term strategy.

item.name: Age of Empires III: The Age of Discovery
item.comment: Pretty cool, need to play again.

item.name: Age of Industry
item.comment: Played both based maps and definitely like this one a bunch, i still prefer brass but I like the variability of the maps, so this will still get played a lot.

item.name: Age of Industry Expansion #1: Japan and Minnesota
Age of Industry Expansion: Belgium & USSR
Age of Industry Expansion: Great Lakes & South Africa
Age of Steam
item.comment: I enjoyed it, definitely had some cool aspect to it that I had not anticipated. I'm looking forward to playing it again.

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion #1: England & Ireland
item.comment: Ireland - I liked it a lot but I wasn't a huge fan of the decolonization action especially in relation to the cities that don't generate new resources. Solid map though. (played with 3 players)

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion #2: Western US and Germany
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion #3: Scandinavia and Korea
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion #4: France and Italy
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: African Diamond Mines & Taiwan Cube Factories
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: America / Europe
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Australia & Tasmania
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Barbados / St. Lucia
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Chile, Egypt and CCCP
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Jamaica / Puerto Rico
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Orient Express & Disoriented Express
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Outer Space & Reversteam
item.comment: Need to play.

item.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Secret Blueprints of Steam Plans 1 & 2
item.comment: Need to play.

item.name: Agricola
item.comment: I enjoy it a lot but get too much brain burn from this. Having started with too many solo games.... my goals ends up just getting as a point maximization problem....which can be timely...

item.name: Agricola: Farmers of the Moor
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Alba Longa
item.comment: Fun game that I would like to get to the table again, we had one rule wrong the first game, so hopefully we get it correct the 2nd time.

item.name: Alea Iacta Est
item.comment: Fun dice game, short enough that I can tolerate the luck factor

item.name: Alhambra
item.comment: A little too random, but enjoyable...I may try the expansions

item.name: Alhambra: Big Box
item.comment: I like having all the different options to add a little more strategy to the game. I have only played the first 3 modules of the #1 expansion.

item.name: Alien Frontiers
item.comment: Despite my dislike for randomness, I like the feel and speed of the game.

item.name: Alien Frontiers: The Mind Control Helmet
item.comment: Very powerful card if used correctly.

item.name: Amber
item.comment: Decent filler game. the 6 players games gets a little chaotic. I could compare this to Tsuro, but without player elimination.

item.name: Amun-Re
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Amyitis
item.comment: Big Ystari fan. This one plays very nicely. I like the multiple paths to victory.

item.name: Android
item.comment: I love the idea of this game... need many more plays to make and big decision as to how much I like the game....

item.name: Android: Netrunner – A Study in Static
Antics!
item.comment: I like this one a lot. The anthill mechanic is very clever and makes for interesting decisions.

item.name: Antike
item.comment: I really enjoyed this. May options and a good use of the rondel. I would like to try this in a group of 5 or 6.

item.name: Antiquity
item.comment: Must keep track of plays so I can see how costly the game really was.

item.name: Apples to Apples
item.comment: Fun at parties...

item.name: Arkadia
item.comment: Very simple and quick game. Seems like there is some depth to the strategy, time will tell how deep.

item.name: Arkham Horror
item.comment: A little too long for my taste of cooperative games... also, it seems too easy....

item.name: Arkham Horror: The King in Yellow Expansion
Artus
item.comment: Played once with 2 players. Lots of fairly tough decisions. I would like to try this with more players.

item.name: Asara
item.comment: Interesting set collection game. Need to modify your plays each round based on the hand you are dealt.

item.name: Assyria
item.comment: Played once. Lots of interesting choices. I like the feeding system and farming system. Should play again soon.

item.name: Asteroyds
item.comment: I like it. I have only played the basic race version of the game.

item.name: At the Gates of Loyang
item.comment: Very cool game. I am a huge fan of antiquity, so this is basically a light version of it without worrying about poisoning the earth.. Very nice with 2 and 4. I haven't played it with 3 because it feels it will take too long.

item.name: Automobile
item.comment: Played it twice, once with 3 players and once with 4 players. Definitely enjoyed it more with 4 players. I wish the other players in the my group were more interested in trying this again.

item.name: Ave Caesar
item.comment: Played with 3 players each taking 2 chariots and you score for both.... it was interesting but I would like to play with 6 players...

item.name: Bargain Hunter
item.comment: Interesting trick taking game. The trump mechanic makes the play feel unique in addition to the scoring mechanism. Solid game for 3 or 4.

item.name: Basilica
item.comment: Solid 2 Player game. Actually works as a 2 player area control game.

item.name: BattleLore
item.comment: I enjoy it but the setup and cleanup time is annoying...

item.name: Battlestar Galactica
item.comment: Very enjoyable. Sometimes the game drags if the cylons just felt like revealing right off the back. More fun to play with devious cylons.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica: Exodus Expansion
item.comment: I like the Cylon fleet board the most as one of the main issues in my head with the base game is long draughts in combat. The Ionian nebula and allies is interesting and gives the game a very different feel. I like having more options for executions.

item.name: Battlestar Galactica: Pegasus Expansion
item.comment: I do like the cylon leaders a lot. I would rather play with 5 players, but having the leaders is far better than the sympathizer. Pegasis is nice, but very strong. I like to think of new caprica as a long resolution phase rather than a strategic part of the game.

item.name: Beep! Beep!
item.comment: Like the game Speed but in reverse. It is a fun quick set matching game. The horn may be a little overpowered but everyone should be paying attention for it.

item.name: Beer & Pretzels
item.comment: Need to Play

item.name: Belfort
item.comment: Lots of downtime, but I expect that to decrease with more plays. I haven't played with the interactive guilds yet.

item.name: Betrayal at House on the Hill
Birds on a Wire
item.comment: Very random, while interesting, it is the worst in the gryphon small box series so far.

item.name: Bisikle
item.comment: I like pitchcar a lot more. This game is cool but I haven't learned how to control the zball much yet.

item.name: Blokus
item.comment: pretty cool. felt very easy to get all my pieces on the board in a 4 player game. Perhaps this was due to the other players. Lots of player interaction, which was nice.

item.name: Blokus Trigon
item.comment: way easier to get the whole board blocked up than the original. This makes the game harder, which is plus to me. nice player interaction.

item.name: Bohnanza
item.comment: Cool little game. Need to play it more to see if it is just random.

item.name: Bohnaparte
item.comment: need to play

item.name: Bombay
item.comment: pretty cool, fairly simple, but plenty of aspects of the game to explore.

item.name: Botswana
item.comment: Considering the simplicity of the game, the game still have interesting decisions and tension.

item.name: The Bottle Imp
item.comment: very cool card come. I am a little worried that the catch mechanism is too much, but I still love the game.

item.name: Brass
item.comment: Very cool...I have yet to win this one....it will come.

item.name: Bridge
item.comment: how good this is depends on the group and whether playing duplicate or contract bridge. I used to have a bridge group but since they have all moved away I have not played in a while. I love reading about different convention systems though.

item.name: Byzantium
item.comment: This is a solid game. Though it is on the longer end and I enjoy a number of martin wallace's titles more.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$
item.comment: Very fun. Enjoyed the Cop variant.

item.name: Ca$h 'n Gun$: Yakuzas
item.comment: played once, don't remember it much, similar to the original though, just with a few more people and options.

item.name: Campaign Manager 2008
item.comment: played once, very nice 2 player game.

item.name: Carcassonne
item.comment: Very random but enjoyable, especially with 2 players.... Gets crazy random with the edition of any expansions where meeples can be removed...

item.name: Carcassonne: Expansion 1 – Inns & Cathedrals
item.comment: Very nice expansion, adds some new tiles for a longer game with a little more to think about.

item.name: Carcassonne: Expansion 2 – Traders & Builders
item.comment: I like it, but there is an extra luck factor added with collecting the resources...

item.name: Carcassonne: The Princess & the Dragon
item.comment: pretty bad, very random....long time planning not really required anymore

item.name: Carcassonne: The Tower
item.comment: decent, but the ability to remove meeples does screw with planning....I would use this expansion.

item.name: Carson City
item.comment: one play, it was very nice. All 4 of us playing enjoyed it. Looking forward to trying out the variants.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy
item.comment: I have enjoyed the game a lot, I think I prefer everyone using the same board so that there is more competition for resources. The being said the variety that the different boards provide is pleasant.

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy: 1st Expansion – New Player Boards
item.comment: Looking forward to these

item.name: The Castles of Burgundy: 2nd Expansion – New Hex Tiles
Catacombs
item.comment: I don't play many dungeon crawlers. This one is much more enjoyable to me because it replaces dice with dexterity. My one friend likes flicking very hard and it makes it hard to keep track of everything that is hit in the chaos that follows. (He can flick at only 1 speed. )

item.name: Catacombs: Cavern of Soloth
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Caylus
item.comment: Awesome game. Most of my plays are with 2 players and I love it. I still have tons to learn in this game...

item.name: Caylus Magna Carta
item.comment: one play with 2 players. not as good as caylus but a lighter version that my girlfriend will play.

item.name: Chess
item.comment: fun game

item.name: Chez Geek
item.comment: Okay filler game...

item.name: Citadels
item.comment: I enjoyed this a lot but having played it enough to reach a real verdict. Lots of opportunities for king making, but that is not a big deal if the game plays quick. My group plays this game way too slowly to be very enjoyable.

item.name: Citadels: The Dark City
item.comment: included a few cards in one game, it was okay

item.name: Cities
item.comment: Pretty fun puzzle

item.name: City Tycoon
item.comment: I like it, I expect it to get much better over time as well.

item.name: Colonia
item.comment: played once with 6 players, which was a lot. 2 players took up over has the play time, neither of them doing well enough for first or 2nd. I recommend playing this game quick the first time as you will just be wasting time trying to make the best play at every moment. Felt very hard to plan in this game.

item.name: Colosseum
item.comment: Very fun... though trading leads to king making often....I love the theme.

item.name: Commands & Colors: Ancients
item.comment:
Stickering took forever...
Cool game, haven't played much yet...

item.name: Concept
item.comment: Cool Idea, need to create actual rules for scoring

item.name: Court of the Medici
item.comment: Simple game with plenty of strategy.

item.name: Cranium
item.comment: I like the game, but luck of the draw happens. very fun.

item.name: Cranium Pop 5
item.comment: I like the way you get to rank each task, this mitigates most of the luck that cranium had. awesome party game.

item.name: Crokinole
item.comment: http://hilinski.net/woodgames/crokinole_gallery/Spruce.jpg

item.name: Day & Night
item.comment: nice 2 player game with some randomness. I can probably get my girlfriend to play it again, but it is a little too confrontational for her.

item.name: Diplomacy
item.comment: I have only played once and it was very enjoyable. I will never play with couples again. (2 banded together outside of reason, 2 got too angry at each other). The one play was by email.

item.name: Dirty Minds: The Game of Naughty Clues
item.comment: nice little filler game.

item.name: Discworld: Ankh-Morpork
item.comment: Fun and random. A hand management game with hidden agendas.

item.name: Dixit
item.comment: Cool variation on balderdash

item.name: Dixit 2: "The American" promo card
item.comment: slightly adds to the replayability....

item.name: Dixit Odyssey
item.comment: More card + More Players = Awesome

item.name: Dixit Quest
item.comment: additionally cards add to the replayability

item.name: Dominant Species
item.comment:
Played most of a game until one player wasn't enjoying the game due to his dominated species.
I enjoyed the worker placement mechanics (same as age of empires III)

item.name: Dominion
item.comment:
Very cool.
I hate so much shuffling mid game...I should make the dominion chips....
also...can be really lucky or unlucky....

item.name: Dominion: Alchemy
item.comment: i will keep buying them. I do enjoy the game, I just never feel like playing it over other things. If there was more time for gaming, it would get played more.

item.name: Dominion: Black Market Promo Card
item.comment: see above

item.name: Dominion: Cornucopia
item.comment: see above

item.name: Dominion: Envoy Promo Card
item.comment: see above

item.name: Dominion: Intrigue
item.comment: see above

item.name: Dominion: Prosperity
item.comment: best expansion by far.

item.name: Dominion: Seaside
item.comment: see above

item.name: Dominion: Stash Promo Card
item.comment: see above

item.name: Drako
item.comment: Pretty cool 2 player game, each game as ended with a very exciting and tight conclusion.

item.name: Duck Dealer
item.comment: played it once. this game is long. i did really enjoy it though. not as much as other splotter titles but i would really like to try this again.
item.wishlistcomment: Courtesy of my 2009 Secret Santa. Thanks!

item.name: Dungeon Lords
item.comment: its very cool though it plays too long for what it is. very deep game though.

item.name: Dungeon Lords: Festival Season
item.comment: funagain

item.name: DVONN
item.comment: Very nice abstract. I enjoy both stages of the game. One of my favorites in the GIPF series.

item.name: Egizia
item.comment: Played it once with 4 players and enjoyed it. Once player did make a horrible misplay at the end of the game which altered the winner (though I bet plays like this are more rare).

item.name: Eminent Domain
item.comment: Awesome game. Plenty of strategies to be discovered. Seems like it would be easy to add expansions in the future.

item.name: The End of the Triumvirate
item.comment: Nice 3 players control game. I enjoy the various winning conditions. The game was very tense throughout.

item.name: Endeavor
item.comment: very nice. I like the many available strategies. All games have been with 4 players. I'm interested to play with 3 or 5.

item.name: Era of Inventions
item.comment: Funagain

item.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Doomed
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – The Pit
Factory Fun
item.comment: very cool puzzle game (which should be a category for game types...)
item.wishlistcomment: If only I could somehow find this...!!

item.name: Famous Forehand: The World's Smallest Tennis Game
A Few Acres of Snow
item.comment: Solid drafting game, I would like to play this more to learn the different nuances of strategy.

item.name: Firenze
item.comment: Ordered English version from Amazon.de

item.name: FITS
item.comment: Basically, it is a game of playing the odds. Unlike tetris, each piece will only present itself once and you can choose to not play a piece if desired. Definitely a lot of luck involved. But playing 4 rounds each games lessens the luck a bit.

item.name: For Sale
item.comment: Solid quick auction game. It isn't my first choice of game to play ever, but works well as a quick filler.

item.name: Forbidden Island
item.comment: cool coop, doesn't feel as difficult as pandemic, but it is still cool. The thing I like about it over pandemic is the variable maps.

item.name: Formula D
item.comment: Need to play it more as I have only played it with 2 people.

item.name: Formula D: Circuits 1 – Sebring & Chicago
item.comment: played sebring once

item.name: Formula D: Circuits 2 – Hockenheim and Valencia
item.comment: need to play

item.name: Fresco
item.comment: I enjoy the game, but need to include at least modules 1,2 and 3.

item.name: Fresco: Expansion Module 7 – The Scrolls
item.comment: Very simple addition to the game.

item.name: Fresco: Expansion Modules 4, 5 and 6
item.comment: Need to play... they all seem to add a few more options to the game. I am most interested in the stained glass module.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker
item.comment: I am a big fan of this game though it eventually got a little too easy.

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: Another Big Expansion
item.comment: funagain

item.name: Galaxy Trucker: The Big Expansion
item.comment: Now I generally play with at 4 rough road cards to level out the playing field, it can get very brutal. Awesome game.

item.name: Galaxy's Edge
item.comment: played it once with 3 players. definitely will mostly play this with 4 people going forward for the same reason I will only play settlers with 4 people. Since the map size stays the same, 2 people end up getting in eachothers way while the other person runs away with it (3 players). Not sure on a rating yet.

item.name: A Game of Thrones (first edition)
item.comment: want to play this more though having 5 willing people is sometimes difficult.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: A Clash of Kings Expansion
item.comment: need to play

item.name: A Game of Thrones: A Storm of Swords Expansion
item.comment: an okay version, though I do like worrying about the sea as well.

item.name: A Game of Thrones: The Board Game (Second Edition)
Gem Dealer
item.comment: need to play

item.name: Genesis
item.comment: Played once... Very quick game and I would like to try it a few more times to make a decisions on how I feel about it.

item.name: Genoa
item.comment: I enjoyed this game, but has trading is basically the whole game, it needs to be with the right group of people so that KingMaking isn't too bad.

item.name: GIPF
item.comment: The hardest game in the GIPF project for me to play well. The strategy is very tough and the game is very unforgiving if playing a better opponent. Reminds me of chess in those regards.

item.name: Glen More
item.comment: Clever little game. Need to collect some booze. The mechanics for the dummy player don't feel as force either, which is a plus.

item.name: Glory to Rome
item.comment: I really enjoy the game. It is a lot of fun to find crazy combos to exploit.

item.name: Go
item.comment: its cool, I will never master this.

item.name: Goa
item.comment: Very fun. Probably my favorite auction game. I am curious how many different paths to victory there are and that is the only thing keep me from ranking this game a 10.

item.name: Goblins, Inc.
item.comment: funagain

item.name: Gold Thief
item.comment: Fun filler. Basically it is random, but there is definitely enough skill in it for a game of this length. Most will enjoy this game.

item.name: Graenaland
item.comment: played once. used the learning game rules. This games seems like it will be better or worse depending on the group of people involved. Clever design.

item.name: Grand Cru
item.comment: I enjoy it but have a big problem with the rules around picking the initial starting player. Once the game gets going, it is a very solid game, but it sucks to start off on very uneven footing despite identical play. That being said, I still really enjoy the game.

item.name: El Grande
item.comment: I like this game a lot. Basically a game of balance short term point gains verses long term position...

item.name: Greed Incorporated
item.comment: Cool game with the right group. We definitely do not value things correctly (we give way more value to the person who has the good than who as the way to upgrade the goods, which might be right....)

item.name: Grimoire
item.comment: Fun little filler.

item.name: Ground Floor
item.comment: kickstarter

item.name: Haggis
item.comment: Solid alternative to tichu. Much harder to determine the ideal play. Also much harder to evaluate the strength of hand due to all the possible bombs and wilds.

item.name: Hamburgum
item.comment: I like it. While not my favorite of Mac Gerdts, I do enjoy the simplicity of the game and use of the Rondel.

item.name: Hanabi
item.comment: Very frustrating with the wrong group, but amazing with the right group.

item.name: Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage
item.comment: took a while to get used to the rules, but the game plays nicely

item.name: Hansa Teutonica
item.comment: a little bit of randomness in which tokens come out. Additionally having somebody to your right who doesn't care much about tokens is a disadvantage for easily grabbing tokens. Other than that the game is great, so close to a 10.

item.name: Hansa Teutonica: East Expansion
item.comment: Need to play

item.name: Le Havre
item.comment: I enjoy this much more than agricola due to varying paths to victory. Looking for fun knew combos with special cards is very enjoyable.

item.name: Le Havre: Le Grand Hameau
item.comment: need to play le havre more

item.name: Hearts
item.comment: used to play a lot online, big fan.

item.name: Hera and Zeus
item.comment: Stratego the card game. I really like a lot of the aspect of this game. While there is some luck involved, bluffing is very enjoyable. Very nice game.

item.name: High Bohn Plus
item.comment: need to play

item.name: High Society
item.comment: I like it. The idea that you can't spend the most money is really clever, creating a very unique dynamic. Some push you luck aspects due to the method in which the game end is triggered.

item.name: Hive
item.comment: cool game. took a few to understand the strategy

item.name: Hive: The Mosquito
item.comment: haven't used yet

item.name: Hollywood Blockbuster
item.comment: Simple auction game.

item.name: Homesteaders
item.comment: need to play

item.name: Imperial
item.comment: Definitely will take a lot of plays to fully understand the depth of this one.

item.name: The Impossible Machine
item.comment: basically dominoes the card game. Enjoyable for a quick filler, but that is about it.

item.name: In the Year of the Dragon
item.comment: Very cool damage control game (basically)

item.name: Incan Gold
item.comment: nice little press your luck game. better with more people as to not have as much of a runaway leader.

item.name: Indonesia
item.comment: I like this a lot and would like to play it more. I compare it a little to Power Grid and I much prefer this.

item.name: Ingenious
item.comment: okay abstract for multiple people

item.name: JAB: Realtime Boxing
item.comment: tasty minstrel games

item.name: Jungle Speed
item.comment: I have this on the Wii. It is very fun, I recommend downloading it if you have a group to play with.

item.name: K2
item.comment: funagain

item.name: Kings of Air and Steam
item.comment: kickstarter

item.name: League of Six
item.comment: Nice auction game. Very different from most others.
item.wishlistcomment: I plan on buying shipyard, so I will inevitably need this as a collector, also, at that point I will have all CGE games...

item.name: League of Six: Loyal Retinue
item.comment: need to play

item.name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game
Leonardo da Vinci
item.comment: its very cool. Not really multiple paths to victory, but definitely multiple strategies to achieve similar results.

item.name: Loaded Questions: Adult Version
item.comment: fun for parties (with a mixed crowd)

item.name: Long Shot
item.comment: it is okay, i like the idea of it, probably should play this again, but I feel a need for more people to play it.

item.name: Looting London
item.comment: need to play

item.name: Lost Cities
item.comment: nice 2 play "rummy" game

item.name: Lost Cities: The Board Game
item.comment: nice multiplayer version.

item.name: Louis XIV
item.comment: Haven't played this in years. Would love to play it again.

item.name: Macao
item.comment: very nice system of collecting resources.

item.name: Die Macher
item.comment:
I love it, I need to play it some more, though 5 people and many hours is hard to arrange.
I want more.

item.name: Mage Knight Board Game: Krang Character Expansion
Mage Knight Board Game: The Lost Legion
Master of Rules
item.comment: its cool, need to play fast or it drags

item.name: Medici
item.comment: need to try this again, only played it once. It pretty cool, very mathy.

item.name: Medici vs Strozzi
item.comment: very mathy 2 player game

item.name: Merkator
item.comment: Funagain

item.name: Once Upon a Time: The Storytelling Card Game
item.comment: with the right group

item.name: Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Character Add-On Deck
The Pillars of the Earth: Builders Duel
The Pillars of the Earth: Expansion Set
Poseidon's Kingdom
item.comment: preordered through fragor

item.name: Power Grid: BGG Promo Card Set
Power Grid: The New Power Plant Cards
Puerto Rico: Expansion I – New Buildings
Quarriors! Key Master Lord of the Quarry Promo Card
Quarriors! Quarmageddon Multiplying Mischievous Imp Promo Card
Race for the Galaxy: Alien Artifacts
Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War
Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
The Resistance: Avalon
item.comment: kickstarter

item.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Rope
item.comment: 2 copies

item.name: Saint Petersburg: New Society & Banquet Expansion
Sator Arepo Tenet Opera Rotas
item.wishlistcomment: Special Edition looks really tempting....probably too much though....

item.name: Settlers of Catan, The - Cities and Knights
Shipyard
item.comment: soon to preorder

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game – Fame and Fortune
Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game – Wisdom and Warfare
Snow Tails: The Leap of Death
Speed
item.comment: Quick and fun. Great filler....

item.name: Spellbound
item.comment: fragor

item.name: Terra Mystica
